bill.title: Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

committee.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

This bill directs the Coast Guard to convey 32 acres of federal land (including all buildings, structures, utilities, and facilities on the land) known as CAMSPAC Housing in Point Reyes Station to Marin County, California, to be used for affordable housing or to provide a public benefit approved by the County.

The property must be sold at fair market value.

The Coast Guard may deposit the proceeds in the Coast Guard Housing Fund.

The Coast Guard's authority to convey the property expires after four years.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 302.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.title: Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act
To direct the Commandant of the Coast Guard to convey certain property from the United States to the County of Marin, California.
Point Reyes Coast Guard Housing Conveyance Act

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 45 (Tuesday, March 17, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. HUFFMAN:H.R. 1402.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2: The Congress shall havePower to dispose of and make all needful Rules andRegulations respecting the Territory or other Propertybelonging to the United States.[Page H1722]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
